title: Attachments: Download and Save
text: Nettskjema allows users upload attachments form submissions. vignette explains use functions provided package list, retrieve, save attachments efficiently.

title: Attachments: Download and Save
text: downloading attachments, ’s useful list available files.

what: Listing attachments for a specific submission
title: Attachments: Download and Save
text: submission ID may associated attachments. Use ns_list_submission_attachments() retrieve information available attachments. function returns data.frame details attachment ID, original filename, standardized filename.
code: library(nettskjemar) # Example: List attachments for a specific submission submission_id <- 27685292 ns_list_submission_attachments(submission_id) #>   submissionId  answerId elementId externalElementId textAnswer #> 1     27685292 158263134   1641713      attachment_1  sølvi.png #>   answerAttachmentId  filename mediaType   size elementType #> 1             538819 sølvi.png image/png 628613  ATTACHMENT #>   attachment.answerAttachmentId attachment.filename attachment.mediaType #> 1                        538819           sølvi.png            image/png #>   attachment.size counter #> 1          628613       1

what: Listing all attachments for a form
title: Attachments: Download and Save
text: list attachments across multiple submissions form, use ns_list_form_attachments().
code: # Example: List attachments for an entire form formid <- 123823 ns_list_form_attachments(formid) #>    formid formId submissionId  answerId elementId externalElementId  textAnswer #> 16 123823 123823     27685292 158263134   1641713      attachment_1   sølvi.png #> 32 123823 123823     27685302 158263185   3525020      attachment_2 marius.jpeg #>    answerOptionIds externalAnswerOptionIds elementType         createdDate #> 16                                          ATTACHMENT 2023-06-01T20:57:15 #> 32                                          ATTACHMENT 2023-06-01T20:58:33 #>           modifiedDate subElementId answerAttachmentId    filename  mediaType #> 16 2023-06-01T20:57:15           NA             538819   sølvi.png  image/png #> 32 2023-06-01T20:58:33           NA             538820 marius.jpeg image/jpeg #>      size attachment.answerAttachmentId attachment.filename #> 16 628613                        538819           sølvi.png #> 32  89494                        538820         marius.jpeg #>    attachment.mediaType attachment.size counter #> 16            image/png          628613       1 #> 32           image/jpeg           89494       1

title: Attachments: Download and Save
text: identified attachments, can download using ns_get_attachment(). path provided, function returns response object without saving file.
code: #| label: dl1  # Example: Download a single attachment attachment_id <- "12345" ns_get_attachment(attachment_id, path = "downloaded_file.pdf")

title: Attachments: Download and Save
text: Use ns_get_submission_attachments() download save attachments associated single submission. function supports two filename conventions: “standardized” (default): Creates filenames based submission ID counter. “original”: Uses filenames uploaded. save attachments using original filenames: can also specify output directory:
code: #| label: dl2  # Example: Save all attachments for a submission ns_get_submission_attachments(submission_id) #| label: dl3  ns_get_submission_attachments(submission_id, filenames = "original") #| label: dl4  ns_get_submission_attachments(submission_id, output_dir = "my_attachments/")

title: Attachments: Download and Save
text: download save attachments form: submission attachments, can specify filename format output directory:
code: #| label: dl5  ns_get_form_attachments(formid) #| label: dl6  ns_get_form_attachments(   formid,   filenames = "original",   output_dir = "all_attachments/" )

title: Attachments: Download and Save

what: Setting up a custom GET request

text: First, need identify functionality want use Nettskjema API docs. Let’s assume want update settings form. , can first retrieve settings stored, alter setting want alter, send back Nettskjema. API docs, URL getting Settings form shown /api/v3/form/{formId}/settings, URL need build access information. ns_req() function, build URL including /api/v3 need add rest. ns_req() function looks like ns_auth() sets authentication client described Authentication vignette. Meaning use , important parts make sure connect correct API correct credentials. can see, output shows URL v3 section, also Authorization added, function background authentication information set shown Authentication vignette. , need use functions {httr2} build remaining url. Now, can see path requested API documentation. request submitted yet! far, just creating command want send API. send request, need use req_perform function httr2. case, also saved output request variable environment, can work received, without send request times. response object shows stats 200 standard response request fulfilled without error. receive errors, httr2 show clearly, need debug wrong. Now response, need “unpack” , can get data sent response, settings form. use httr2 functions . general, Nettskjema API responses come json “body” response (API lingo, just go .). Using resp_body_json() function httr2, automatically unpack json R list-format, can easily work . endpoints Nettskjema API send json, instance ones retrieve files server (excel, SPSS, PDF), come binary form. , package contains functions retrieve specific files , mention need pay attention format response know unpack data correctly.

title: Enhanced Workflow with Labelled Data
text: data labelled, haven package provides functionalities inspect manipulate labels ease.

title: Enhanced Workflow with Labelled Data
text: Use var_label() extract variable-level labels val_labels() extract value-level labels:
code: library(labelled) # Variable labels var_label(lab_data$freetext) #> [1] "This is a question about something super important, where the user can input free text." # Value labels for 'radio' val_labels(lab_data$radio) #>   Very happy! Very unhappy!  #>             1            -1

title: Enhanced Workflow with Labelled Data
text: need modify labels, suggest directly Nettskjema codebook setup. However, working form longer available Nettskjema, downloaded saved data codebook (labelled data), labels can modified using haven:
code: lab_data$freetex #> [1] "some text"      "another answer" ""               #> attr(,"label") #> [1] "This is a question about something super important, where the user can input free text." #> attr(,"ns_type") #> [1] "QUESTION" #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "character" # Update variable-level label for 'freetext' var_label(lab_data$freetext) <- "Important freetext comment"  lab_data$radio #> <labelled<integer>[3]>: How happy are we with Nettskjema? #> [1]  1 -1 -1 #>  #> Labels: #>  value         label #>      1   Very happy! #>     -1 Very unhappy! # Update value labels for 'radio' val_labels(lab_data$radio) <- c(Unhappy = -1, Happy = 1)  # Check updated labels var_label(lab_data$freetext) #> [1] "Important freetext comment" val_labels(lab_data$radio) #> Unhappy   Happy  #>      -1       1

Compatibility: Facilitates interoperability SPSS, Stata, statistical software. information, check labelled package documentation.

title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
text: Forms Nettskjema come associated metadata, title, contact information, status. vignette demonstrates use functions : 1. Retrieve metadata specific form. 2. Save metadata file safe keeping.

title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
text: executing function, ensure authenticated. Refer vignette authentication (authentication.html) guidance. Additionally, load required package:

what: Retrieving Metadata for a Form: ns_get_meta
title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
text: function ns_get_meta retrieves metadata given form using form ID. retrieved metadata returned object class ns_meta.

previous_headings: Retrieving Metadata for a Form: ns_get_meta
title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
text: ’s example retrieve metadata form: metadata object includes various details form, title, number submissions, whether codebook valid.
code: library(nettskjemar)  # Replace this with your form ID formid <- 123823  # Retrieve metadata for the form form_meta <- ns_get_meta(formid)  # Display the metadata form_meta #> $form_id #> [1] 123823 #>  #> $title #> [1] "API test form" #>  #> $canEditForm #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $isCodebookValid #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $hasSubmissions #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $modifiedDate #> [1] "2025-08-26T13:08:28" #>  #> $modifiedBy #> $modifiedBy$personId #> [1] 3439404 #>  #> $modifiedBy$username #> [1] "ccda25ce-8256-4c6f-ba71-7a4357dc6caf@apiclient" #>  #> $modifiedBy$name #> [1] "nettskjemar" #>  #> $modifiedBy$email #> [1] "athanasm@uio.no" #>  #> $modifiedBy$type #> [1] "API_CLIENT" #>  #>  #> $isOpen #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $deliveryDestination #> [1] "DATABASE" #>  #> $projectName #> NULL #>  #> $numberOfPostponedSubmissions #> [1] 0 #>  #> $numberOfSubmissions #> [1] 3 #>  #> $numberOfInvitations #> [1] 0 #>  #> $editorsContactEmail #> [1] "a.m.mowinckel@psykologi.uio.no" #>  #> $editorsContactUrl #> NULL #>  #> $lastSubmissionDate #> [1] "2023-06-01T20:59:50" #>  #> $markedForDeletionDate #> NULL #>  #> $deleteDate #> NULL #>  #> $receiptText #> NULL #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "ns_meta" "list"

title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
text: metadata object structured list useful information form. can directly access individual fields metadata object list.

title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
code: # Access the title of the form form_meta$title #> [1] "API test form"  # Check the number of submissions num_submissions <- form_meta$numberOfSubmissions print(paste("Number of submissions:", num_submissions)) #> [1] "Number of submissions: 3"  # Check if the form is open is_open <- form_meta$isOpen print(paste("Is the form open?:", is_open)) #> [1] "Is the form open?: FALSE"

what: Saving Metadata to a File: ns_write_meta
title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
text: metadata retrieved using ns_get_meta can saved file safe keeping use. ns_write_meta function writes metadata JSON file, preserving information structured format.

previous_headings: Saving Metadata to a File: ns_write_meta
what: Example: Save Metadata as a JSON File
title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
code: # Replace with your desired file path output_path <- "meta_110000.json"  # Save the metadata to the specified path ns_write_meta(form_meta, output_path)

previous_headings: Saving Metadata to a File: ns_write_meta > Example: Save Metadata as a JSON File
what: Example: Save Metadata to a Custom Path
title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
text: file doesn’t .json extension, function automatically append file name.
code: # Save to a file without .json extension ns_write_meta(form_meta, "meta_file") #> ℹ Switching file extension to .json  # The file will be saved as "meta_file.json"

previous_headings: Saving Metadata to a File: ns_write_meta > Example: Save Metadata as a JSON File
what: Example: Use Custom JSON Formatting Options
title: Working with Nettskjema Form Metadata
text: ns_write_meta function supports additional arguments passed jsonlite::write_json function. example, can specify pretty = TRUE human-readable format.
code: # Save the metadata in a pretty-printed JSON file ns_write_meta(   form_meta,   "pretty_meta.json",   pretty = TRUE )

Checkboxes returned binary columns, one columns per checkbox 1 indicates checkbox ticked. provide extra functionality help work data. Currently support working checkbox matrix questions, working solution checkboxes. can separated rows wanted, using tidyverse syntax. used working list columns, another option work delimited strings columns. procedure, can turn checkboxes character column, option separated character choosing.

what: Connect to the nettskjema.no API of the University of Oslo
title: Connect to the nettskjema.no API of the University of Oslo
text: goal {nettskjemar} easy access data form information Nettskjema service University Oslo, Norway. Currently main possibilities help creating users tokens accessing Nettskjema API, downloading meta-data codebooks specific forms data associated specific form. Install released version CRAN : Newer releases can installed authors r-universe: Install development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("nettskjemar") # Enable this universe options(   repos = c(     lcbc_uio = 'https://CAPRO-UIO.r-universe.dev',     CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'   ) )  # Install some packages install.packages('nettskjemar') # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("CAPRO-UIO/nettskjemar")

title: Nettskjema API Sitrep — ns_sitrep
text: function provides situational report (sitrep) Nettskjema R package. outputs detailed information package version, API configuration, environment variables, tests API connectivity credentials available.

title: Nettskjema API Sitrep — ns_sitrep

title: Nettskjema API Sitrep — ns_sitrep
text: function performs following: - Displays installed version `nettskjemar` package. - Validates `NETTSKJEMA_CLIENT_ID` `NETTSKJEMA_CLIENT_SECRET` environment variables. - Checks API base URL connectivity attempts test request credentials configured. - Displays system environment details R version operating system.
